title: Signed into my Firefox account with primary password but Firefox won't accept my primary password for the passwords section
content:
Hello,

I installed Firefox on my new laptop recently and am suddenly encountering an issue today where whenever I go to log into a site with one of my saved passwords (autofill), Firefox is prompting me to enter my primary password in a pop-up. I'm already signed into my Mozilla/Firefox account on the device and browser, though, and when I type in my correct primary password Firefox doesn't accept it. It prompts me again.

I checked on the Firefox browser on my old laptop, and it does the same thing now - prompting me for my primary password even though I'm already signed in on the device and browser, and not accepting it when I enter it. On both machines, in the settings section, it allows me to change my primary password and I did so successfully, but still receive the prompts.

Even if I sign out of my Mozilla/Firefox account on the device/browser, then successfully sign back in using my primary password, it still sends these unrelenting prompts for my primary password when I go to sign into a site with my saved password (autofill) that aren't satisfied by entering the correct/current primary password.

Please assist!
creator: tim.perlow

title: BBC website blocks vertical scroll (!)
content:
A very odd behaviour! If I pull up the BBC website in FF and move to any news item or article, then my vertical scrollbar is disabled. I can re-enable it by reloading the page and the problem does not recur for the rest of the session. (Just very occasionally it happens after the second navigation rather than the first). Trivial I know, but an irritation (as well as a malfunction!)

I also have the taskbar fails to display in FF, curable by a double-tap on the Win Key. Is this going to be sorted on an update? Also trivial/irritation! TIA

title: FF network settings goofed up
content:
On windows 10, Firefox Browsing/surfing was slow so I did netsh winsock reset and ip reset etc.

But thereafter few sites in-page notifications aren‚Äôt loading properly like facebook notifications, forum notifications, amazon page etc.

Nothing works irrespective of cookie or entire history deletion.

I had to fiddle with the networking settings few months back so unsure what are the stock FF settings- what they should be like. I wasn‚Äôt able to find on google.

I did performed a FF refresh and even created a now profile and that works absolutely fine!

But the moment I log into my FF cloud account for re-syncing all add-ons, bookmarks etc and dang the issue reverts. So I think 110% the FF account sync is restoring back the network settings I did some time ago overriding the default ones hence the good up.

All other browsers like edge/chrome are working fine.

What I want is- 

   * The default FF network settings which I can correct and re-sync back to my FF cloud account.    * Or a way to only restore bookmarks and extensions/add-ons and nothing else from the cloud account.

title: "Table of Contents" button inhibits text; how ro remove, permanently?
content:
image of problem Some, but not all, pages browsed throw up a "hamburger" menu, top left of the window. (the link above should link you to a screenshot taken this morning in Firefox 142.0.1 (64) running on Win11.)

The menu button floats eternally over the text in that top-left corner. This irritates me because I read text, and am frustrated by the browser covering readable text.

I can't remember ever (20+ years) needing the Table Of Contents of a web page. I use Mozilla Firefox's excellent Edit, Find if I want to jump directly to a key word.

Anyone who can suggest a perpetual dismissal of this menu button will earn my lifelong admiration!

I can deal with Settings, About:Config, and even RegEdit. Thanks, Chris

title: Security
content: I recently upgraded my Router to an ASUS AX5400 and when I tried to sign in t the configuration site (192.168.50.1:8443) Firefox prevents me from proceeding due to an incorrect or non authorised site. What I find most annoying is that not only does Firefox issue a warning (that's fine) but there is then no way to proceed by accepting the danger (none in this case) and proceeding to login to my own Router that I have just purchased. So, the only way to set up and subsequently administer my Router is to use either MS Edge or Brave who provide a warning but then allow me to accept the risk and proceed to the Router's configuration settings. ASUS do provide a Certificate which I have added to my Trusted Root Directory and also to the Firefox Certificate repository but apparently, for reasons I don't understand, the Certificate, although issued by ASUS, is not signed by a certified authority that is acceptable to Firefox. Does anyone know how to get around this problem using the Firefox browser? Just why Firefox think it is OK to block me from accessing my own Router is beyond me!! This is equal to the arrogance often displayed by Microsoft i.e. we'll give you what WE think you need not what you need. By the way - I have also written to ASUS to ask them why on earth that don't issue a suitable Certificate for a $250 Router.
creator: Sandgroper48

title: Duplicate install of Firefox
content:
Hello all!

I've started having an issue in the last few days, with apparently two separate Firefox installs. A few days ago I was greeted by a fresh, blank install of Firefox and had to set everything up and sign in as I usually would on a fresh system install. Today, however, I somehow managed to launch both of them at once (I don't know how, as I just use the UI shortcut). After closing both fully, I can now only start the "old" one via the shortcut.

OS: Bluefin / Fedora 42.20, Gnome 48.6

According to the list of flatpaks, only one is installed. Unfortunately that's roughly where my knowledge of Linux ends, so I can't troubleshoot this further. Help will be apprecciated, as I don't want to roll a die on which of these will start up every time I reboot.
creator: erazem.jurkovic

title: Firefox and streaming services
content:
Hello community,

Since the last update, I have been experiencing issues with streaming services, such as Disney+. Playback is no longer scaled correctly in full-screen mode.

During playback, the image is displayed much smaller with black borders at the top and bottom, as if Disney+ and Firefox are unable to communicate the format correctly.

I have already searched the web for this issue and have not found any articles with the same error description.

System: Win11 Pro, everything is up to date, WIN resolution: 3440 x 1440 (125% scaling)

Attached is a screenshot with the playback in full screen mode. I have framed what is displayed.

title: Read-Out Voice in Reader-Mode, doesn't switch after Translation
content:
Hi Support Community,

I wanted to share a strange finding. I‚Äôm currently learning Vietnamese and often read articles with translations to improve my comprehension. I also use Reader Mode with voice playback to practice my listening and speaking skills.

Today, I accidentally pressed Play after translating a news article ‚Äî and to my surprise, a Vietnamese voice started reading the English text aloud! I tried changing the voice settings, but it seems the model is stuck (Standard = Vietnamese). And it can be fun, listening to that Viet voice trying to pronounce English words, but in the end, it's of no use. I would rather prefer a matching englisch voice modell, in case I should decide to listen to the translated text, one day.

It‚Äôs not a big issue, but I thought this might be something worth passing along to the development team.

Thanks in advance!

title: sessionstore-logs and sessionstore-backups files
content:
Hello ~ Re. On Macbook Pro, I messed up all sessionstore folders and files. 

After a recent Firefox crash (maybe due to repeated bad connections and using a VPV in China), I lost all my previous tabs (more than 100) and I also didn't see the "Restore previous session" in History.

I was able to find 'previous.jsonlz4' (and other *.jsonlz4) files on my October 11 Time Machine backup. However, after replacing, renaming, deleting various *.jsonlz4 files, Firefox, after reopening it, disregards any changes (deletions or new tabs) i made on the my last session, and return to the October 11 situation. I know i messed things up (see attached screenshot), but how can i clean that mess?

Thanks, Amos
